channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2681] Portal for Mac: We didn't think this through...
[+1925] At First I Was LOST, Then I LOL'd (PIC)
item.description: Hint: His name is John Locke

item.title: [+1772] When did Apple become uncool?
item.description: It's hard to remember a time when Apple wasn't the coolest company on the planet. In 1984, the company made its voice heard with a groundbreaking Super Bowl ad that launched the Macintosh to the world.

item.title: [+1721] Video of Police officer shooting unarmed cooperating suspect
item.description: Ottawa Hills, Ohio police officer shoots a motorcyclist in the back, with dash cam video showing the rider cooperating with him. The man was left paralyzed for life from this incident.

item.title: [+1625] This is the coolest way I've ever heard to get a job
item.description: All you need is egotism and $6.

item.title: [+1581] What's Your Excuse? (PIC)
[+1466] Home Depot Steals Inventor's Invention; Must Now Pay $25M
item.description: Home Depot had a problem: their employees kept sawing off their own extremities with the saws they used to cut lumber for customers. Michael Powell invented a gadget which fixed the problem, and offered to sell the device to the chain for $2,000 each. Then, the inventor's lawsuit alleged, Home Depot simply stole the gadget's design.

item.title: [+1422] Oh look! A cupcake!
[+1054] Diaspora: The Student-Made, Privacy-Respecting Facebook Alte
item.description: As Facebook completes its Galactic Senate-to-Imperial Empire transformation, four enterprising NYU students thought the world could do with a social networking service that wouldn't treat your personal information like advertiser catnip. So they started building Diaspora.

item.title: [+1020] Why Snakebites Are About to Get a Lot More Deadly
item.description: Envenomation experts express exasperation and disbelief at the situation. "It's ridiculous that we're losing a technology that we already have,.

item.title: [+953] Air Force suffers collateral damage from PS3 firmware update
item.description: The Air Force bought 1,700 160GB PlayStation 3 units in January, all meant to run Linux in a 500 TeraFLOPS cluster. But with the Linux option now removed, the Air Force has no upgrade or repair path.

item.title: [+857] I Hope To God This Never Catches On (PIC)
[+725] Disaster unfolds slowly in the Gulf of Mexico (PICS)
item.description: In the three weeks since the April 20th explosion and sinking of the Deepwater Horizon oil rig in the Gulf of Mexico, and the start of the subsequent massive (and ongoing) oil leak, many attempts have been made to contain and control the scale of the environmental disaster.

item.title: [+698] Lawmaker Wants Nudity AND Alcohol Banned from Strip Clubs
item.description: Missouri stick in the mud Matt Bartle (R-Kansas City) has spent the past eight frickin' years trying to get strippers to not strip and drinkers to not drink in Show-Me state strip clubs. Presumably he wants fun banned, as well as the option for adults to make a decision on their own.

item.title: [+690] Jason Lee: Once A Skateboarder Always A Skateboarder
item.description: I like to remember the old days when Jason Lee was a pro for the newly founded Blind Skateboards. In the old days, he wasnâ€™t too different from the quirky guy he is now. Take a look at these clips.

item.title: [+671] 17 Hysterical Singles Ads (PICS)
item.description: Looking for Love? Try the Personals! Just remember when composing your ad, use a little more thought than these people did

item.title: [+659] Monsanto: The Corporation Poisoning Our Environment
item.description: If you Google, 'the most evil company in the world', your search results will find the company, Monsanto. You've probably never heard of Monsanto, however, you most likely have or have had their products in your cupboards, basement, shed, or food.

item.title: [+631] Who Will Bail Out America?
item.description: Social Security, Medicare and the retirement of the baby boom generation wasn't enough of a burden for the American taxpayer. We will now be paying as well for the generous pensions of Greek bureaucrats retiring in the warm Mediterranean sun at age 55, thanks to the foresighted leadership of our very own international statesman, Barack Obama.

item.title: [+610] How Predatory Lending Works: From Payday Loan to Rent-to-Own
item.description: Unfortunately, some of your brethren do not read Consumerist and can get caught up in the jaws of predatory lenders, wasting limited cash on things like payday loans, bad credit cards, and using rent-to-own stores. So let's take a walk down the wild side and see how each of these bad choices work.

item.title: [+601] U.S. Marines in Afghanistan [Photos]
